page.title: 01AUDLEM, CHESHIRE
page.content: The large village of Audlem, once a market town, is situated in gently rolling countryside, largely given over to the raising of cattle. Many of the fields are heavily fertilised given a certain "flavour" to the locality. Agriculture and associated industries, including specialist farmhouse cheesemaking, continue to employ many of the local population though over the last twenty years there has been a steady increase in numbers of village dwellers working elsewhere. The village serves as a focal point for smaller communities around and can furnish most needs with its variety of shops, three churches, public houses and the Town Hall, where many functions are held. In summer months the Shropshire Union Canal provides a steady stream of tourists. Fine old farmhouses dot the landscape
